{"step_by_step_thinking": "To determine which of the following is NOT the criteria to discharge a patient of dengue haemorrhagic fever, we need to review the criteria for discharge. The criteria for discharge typically include being afebrile for 24 hours without antipyretics, having a platelet count greater than 50,000 cells, return of appetite, and at least 24 hours since recovery from shock. We need to identify the criterion that does not belong to this list.", "answer_choice": "C"}
